definition: loyal and devoted (idiom); faithful and true
lit. red-bellied devotion (idiom); wholehearted loyalty/to serve sb with body and soul

sentences.english: Spurgeon saw this and faithfully obeyed.
sentences.chinese: 司布真看到這點，他忠心地服從。

sentences.english: There seems to have been some very faithful servants of Christ in the Ephesian church.
sentences.chinese: 特別是在以弗所的教會，更有很多忠心事主的信徒。

sentences.english: The shop owner suggests a faithful dog.
sentences.chinese: 店老闆建議他買只忠心的狗。

sentences.english: XuanZu pretends to zen to light the sea king, to test the courtiers faithfulness.
sentences.chinese: 宣祖假裝要禪位給光海君，以此試探臣子們的忠心。

sentences.english: The saying "To serve like a dog or horse" describes one person's great devotion to another.
sentences.chinese: 成語“犬馬之勞”比喻一個人對對方的忠心程度。

sentences.english: Loving God, we desire to be faithful.
sentences.chinese: 慈愛的神，我們渴望忠心於禰。

sentences.english: Yoo sung-ryong said faithful believe true light sea king.
sentences.chinese: 柳成龍表示相信光海君真正的忠心。
英格蘭是他忠心的藩屬。

sentences.english: Zhao is much simpler, excellent fighting skills and a loyal heart.
sentences.chinese: 這次的趙子龍似乎簡單的多，一身好武藝，一片忠心。

sentences.english: Be faithful, even to the point of death, and I will give you the crown of life.
sentences.chinese: 你務要至死忠心，我就賜給你那生命的冠冕。

sentences.english: If you know the Lord Jesus, God will help you be stedfast and faithful to Him.
sentences.chinese: 如果你認識主，神會幫助你忠心到底。

sentences.english: The quality of self-forgetfulness, like faithfulness, is extremely rare.
sentences.chinese: 無私，與忠心一樣，是罕見的特質。

sentences.english: But Daniel was blameless , for he was loyal to both God and the King.
sentences.chinese: 可但以理對王對上帝都忠心耿耿，無可挑剔。

sentences.english: Sharp intention cures, utterly loyal, is a talented individual on the political.
sentences.chinese: 銳意圖治，忠心耿耿，政治上是一位幹才。

definition: loyal and devoted (idiom); faithful and true
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
to vow loyalty and devotion to
lit. red-bellied devotion (idiom); wholehearted loyalty/to serve sb with body and soul
lit. the kindness of recognizing sb's worth and employing him (idiom)/patronage/protection
